  74. ‌static char magicstr[EXEC_MAGIC_LENGTH+1];

  76. /* Print the specified error message followed by an end-of-line and exit */
  77. ‌static void error(char *msg, ...)
  78. {
  79.   va_list ap;
  80.   va_start(ap, msg);
  81.   vfprintf (stderr, msg, ap);
  82.   va_end(ap);
  83.   fprintf(stderr, "\n");
  84.   exit(127);
  85. }

  87. /* Read the trailer of a bytecode file */

  89. ‌static void fixup_endianness_trailer(uint32_t * p)
  90. {
  91. #ifndef ARCH_BIG_ENDIAN
  92.   Reverse_32(p, p);
  93. #endif
  94. }

  96. ‌static int read_trailer(int fd, struct exec_trailer *trail)
  97. {
  98.   if (lseek(fd, (long) -TRAILER_SIZE, SEEK_END) == -1)
  99.     return BAD_BYTECODE;
  100.   if (read(fd, (char *) trail, TRAILER_SIZE) < TRAILER_SIZE)
  101.     return BAD_BYTECODE;
  102.   fixup_endianness_trailer(&trail->num_sections);
  103.   memcpy(magicstr, trail->magic, EXEC_MAGIC_LENGTH);
  104.   magicstr[EXEC_MAGIC_LENGTH] = 0;

  106.   if (caml_params->print_magic) {
  107.     printf("%s\n", magicstr);
  108.     exit(0);
  109.   }
  110.   return
  111.     (strncmp(trail->magic, EXEC_MAGIC, sizeof(trail->magic)) == 0)
  112.       ? 0 : WRONG_MAGIC;
  113. }

  115. ‌enum caml_byte_program_mode caml_byte_program_mode = STANDARD;

  117. ‌int caml_attempt_open(char_os **name, struct exec_trailer *trail,
  118.                       int do_open_script)
  119. {
  120.   char_os * truename;
  121.   int fd;
  122.   int err;
  123.   char buf [2], * u8;

  125.   truename = caml_search_exe_in_path(*name);
  126.   u8 = caml_stat_strdup_of_os(truename);
  127.   caml_gc_message(0x100, "Opening bytecode executable %s\n", u8);
  128.   caml_stat_free(u8);
  129.   fd = open_os(truename, O_RDONLY | O_BINARY);
  130.   if (fd == -1) {
  131.     caml_stat_free(truename);
  132.     caml_gc_message(0x100, "Cannot open file\n");
  133.     if (errno == EMFILE)
  134.       return NO_FDS;
  135.     else
  136.       return FILE_NOT_FOUND;
  137.   }
  138.   if (!do_open_script) {
  139.     err = read (fd, buf, 2);
  140.     if (err < 2 || (buf [0] == '#' && buf [1] == '!')) {
  141.       close(fd);
  142.       caml_stat_free(truename);
  143.       caml_gc_message(0x100, "Rejected #! script\n");
  144.       return BAD_BYTECODE;
  145.     }
  146.   }
  147.   err = read_trailer(fd, trail);
  148.   if (err != 0) {
  149.     close(fd);
  150.     caml_stat_free(truename);
  151.     caml_gc_message(0x100, "Not a bytecode executable\n");
  152.     return err;
  153.   }
  154.   *name = truename;
  155.   return fd;
  156. }

  158. /* Read the section descriptors */

  160. ‌void caml_read_section_descriptors(int fd, struct exec_trailer *trail)
  161. {
  162.   int toc_size, i;

  164.   toc_size = trail->num_sections * 8;
  165.   trail->section = caml_stat_alloc(toc_size);
  166.   lseek(fd, - (long) (TRAILER_SIZE + toc_size), SEEK_END);
  167.   if (read(fd, (char *) trail->section, toc_size) != toc_size)
  168.     caml_fatal_error("cannot read section table");
  169.   /* Fixup endianness of lengths */
  170.   for (i = 0; i < trail->num_sections; i++)
  171.     fixup_endianness_trailer(&(trail->section[i].len));
  172. }

  174. /* Position fd at the beginning of the section having the given name.
  175.    Return the length of the section data in bytes, or -1 if no section
  176.    found with that name. */

  178. ‌int32_t caml_seek_optional_section(int fd, struct exec_trailer *trail,
  179.                                    char *name)
  180. {
  181.   long ofs;
  182.   int i;

  184.   ofs = TRAILER_SIZE + trail->num_sections * 8;
  185.   for (i = trail->num_sections - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
  186.     ofs += trail->section[i].len;
  187.     if (strncmp(trail->section[i].name, name, 4) == 0) {
  188.       lseek(fd, -ofs, SEEK_END);
  189.       return trail->section[i].len;
  190.     }
  191.   }
  192.   return -1;
  193. }

  195. /* Position fd at the beginning of the section having the given name.
  196.    Return the length of the section data in bytes. */

  198. ‌int32_t caml_seek_section(int fd, struct exec_trailer *trail, char *name)
  199. {
  200.   int32_t len = caml_seek_optional_section(fd, trail, name);
  201.   if (len == -1)
  202.     caml_fatal_error("section `%s' is missing", name);
  203.   return len;
  204. }

  206. /* Read and return the contents of the section having the given name.
  207.    Add a terminating 0.  Return NULL if no such section. */

  209. ‌static char * read_section(int fd, struct exec_trailer *trail, char *name)
  210. {
  211.   int32_t len;
  212.   char * data;

  214.   len = caml_seek_optional_section(fd, trail, name);
  215.   if (len == -1) return NULL;
  216.   data = caml_stat_alloc(len + 1);
  217.   if (read(fd, data, len) != len)
  218.     caml_fatal_error("error reading section %s", name);
  219.   data[len] = 0;
  220.   return data;
  221. }

  223. #ifdef _WIN32

  225. ‌static char_os * read_section_to_os(int fd, struct exec_trailer *trail,
  226.                                     char *name)
  227. {
  228.   int32_t len, wlen;
  229.   char * data;
  230.   wchar_t * wdata;

  232.   len = caml_seek_optional_section(fd, trail, name);
  233.   if (len == -1) return NULL;
  234.   data = caml_stat_alloc(len + 1);
  235.   if (read(fd, data, len) != len)
  236.     caml_fatal_error("error reading section %s", name);
  237.   data[len] = 0;
  238.   wlen = caml_win32_multi_byte_to_wide_char(data, len, NULL, 0);
  239.   wdata = caml_stat_alloc((wlen + 1)*sizeof(wchar_t));
  240.   caml_win32_multi_byte_to_wide_char(data, len, wdata, wlen);
  241.   wdata[wlen] = 0;
  242.   caml_stat_free(data);
  243.   return wdata;
  244. }

  246. #else

  248. ‌#define read_section_to_os read_section

  250. #endif

  252. /* Invocation of ocamlrun: 4 cases.

  254.    1.  runtime + bytecode
  255.        user types:  ocamlrun [options] bytecode args...
  256.        arguments:  ocamlrun [options] bytecode args...

  258.    2.  bytecode script
  259.        user types:  bytecode args...
  260.    2a  (kernel 1) arguments:  ocamlrun ./bytecode args...
  261.    2b  (kernel 2) arguments:  bytecode bytecode args...

  263.    3.  concatenated runtime and bytecode
  264.        user types:  composite args...
  265.        arguments:  composite args...

  267. Algorithm:
  268.   1-  If argument 0 is a valid byte-code file that does not start with #!,
  269.       then we are in case 3 and we pass the same command line to the
  270.       OCaml program.
  271.   2-  In all other cases, we parse the command line as:
  272.         (whatever) [options] bytecode args...
  273.       and we strip "(whatever) [options]" from the command line.

  275. */

  277. ‌static void do_print_help(void)
  278. {
  279.   printf("%s\n",
  280.     "Usage: ocamlrun [<options>] [--] <executable> [<command-line>]\n"
  281.     "Options are:\n"
  282.     "  -b  Set runtime parameter b (detailed exception backtraces)\n"
  283.     "  -config  Print configuration values and exit\n"
  284.     "  -events  Trace debug events in bytecode interpreter (ignored \n"
  285.     "      if not ocamlrund)\n"
  286.     "  -I <dir>  Add <dir> to the list of DLL search directories\n"
  287.     "  -m  Print the magic number of <executable> and exit\n"
  288.     "  -M  Print the magic number expected by this runtime and exit\n"
  289.     "  -p  Print the names of the primitives known to this runtime\n"
  290.     "  -t  Trace the execution of the bytecode interpreter (specify multiple\n"
  291.     "      times to increase verbosity)\n"
  292.     "  -v  Set runtime parameter v=61 (GC event information)\n"
  293.     "  -version  Print version string and exit\n"
  294.     "  -vnum  Print short version number and exit\n"
  295.     "  -help  Display this list of options\n"
  296.     "  --help  Display this list of options");
  297. }

  299. /* Parse options on the command line */

  301. ‌static int parse_command_line(char_os **argv)
  302. {
  303.   int i, j, len, parsed;
  304.   /* cast to make caml_params mutable; this assumes we are only called
  305.      by one thread at startup */
  306.   struct caml_params* params = (struct caml_params*)caml_params;

  308.   for(i = 1; argv[i] != NULL && argv[i][0] == '-'; i++) {
  309.     len = strlen_os(argv[i]);
  310.     parsed = 1;
  311.     if (len == 2) {
  312.       /* Single-letter options, e.g. -v */
  313.       switch(argv[i][1]) {
  314.       case '-':
  315.         return i + 1;
  316.         break;
  317.       case 't':
  318.         params->trace_level += 1; /* ignored unless DEBUG mode */
  319.         break;
  320.       case 'v':
  321.         atomic_store_relaxed(&caml_verb_gc, 0x001+0x004+0x008+0x010+0x020);
  322.         break;
  323.       case 'p':
  324.         for (j = 0; caml_names_of_builtin_cprim[j] != NULL; j++)
  325.           printf("%s\n", caml_names_of_builtin_cprim[j]);
  326.         exit(0);
  327.         break;
  328.       case 'b':
  329.         params->backtrace_enabled = 1;
  330.         break;
  331.       case 'I':
  332.         if (argv[i + 1] != NULL) {
  333.           caml_ext_table_add(&caml_shared_libs_path, argv[i + 1]);
  334.           i++;
  335.         } else {
  336.           error("option '-I' needs an argument.");
  337.         }
  338.         break;
  339.       case 'm':
  340.         params->print_magic = 1;
  341.         break;
  342.       case 'M':
  343.         printf("%s\n", EXEC_MAGIC);
  344.         exit(0);
  345.         break;
  346.       default:
  347.         parsed = 0;
  348.       }
  349.     } else {
  350.       /* Named options, e.g. -version */
  351.       if (!strcmp_os(argv[i], T("-version"))) {
  352.         printf("%s\n", "The OCaml runtime, version " OCAML_VERSION_STRING);
  353.         exit(0);
  354.       } else if (!strcmp_os(argv[i], T("-vnum"))) {
  355.         printf("%s\n", OCAML_VERSION_STRING);
  356.         exit(0);
  357.       } else if (!strcmp_os(argv[i], T("-events"))) {
  358.         params->event_trace = 1; /* Ignored unless DEBUG mode */
  359.       } else if (!strcmp_os(argv[i], T("-help")) ||
  360.                  !strcmp_os(argv[i], T("--help"))) {
  361.         do_print_help();
  362.         exit(0);
  363.       } else if (!strcmp_os(argv[i], T("-config"))) {
  364.         params->print_config = 1;
  365.       } else {
  366.         parsed = 0;
  367.       }
  368.     }

  370.     if (!parsed)
  371.       error("unknown option %s", caml_stat_strdup_of_os(argv[i]));
  372.   }

  374.   return i;
  375. }

  377. /* Print the configuration of the runtime to stdout; memory allocated is not
  378.    freed, since the runtime will terminate after calling this. */
  379. ‌static void do_print_config(void)
  380. {
  381.   int i;
  382.   char_os * dir;

  384.   /* Print the runtime configuration */
  385.   printf("version: %s\n", OCAML_VERSION_STRING);
  386.   printf("standard_library_default: %s\n",
  387.          caml_stat_strdup_of_os(OCAML_STDLIB_DIR));
  388.   printf("standard_library: %s\n",
  389.          caml_stat_strdup_of_os(caml_get_stdlib_location()));
  390.   printf("int_size: %d\n", 8 * (int)sizeof(value));
  391.   printf("word_size: %d\n", 8 * (int)sizeof(value) - 1);
  392.   printf("os_type: %s\n", OCAML_OS_TYPE);
  393.   printf("host: %s\n", HOST);
  394.   printf("flat_float_array: %s\n",
  395. #ifdef FLAT_FLOAT_ARRAY
  396.          "true");
  397. #else
  398.          "false");
  399. #endif
  400.   printf("supports_afl: %s\n",
  401. #ifdef HAS_SYS_SHM_H
  402.          "true");
  403. #else
  404.          "false");
  405. #endif
  406.   printf("windows_unicode: %s\n",
  407. #if WINDOWS_UNICODE
  408.          "true");
  409. #else
  410.          "false");
  411. #endif
  412.   printf("supports_shared_libraries: %s\n",
  413. #ifdef SUPPORT_DYNAMIC_LINKING
  414.          "true");
  415. #else
  416.          "false");
  417. #endif
  418.   printf("no_naked_pointers: true\n");
  419.   printf("compression_supported: %s\n",
  420. #ifdef HAS_ZSTD
  421.          "true");
  422. #else
  423.          "false");
  424. #endif
  425.   printf("reserved header bits: %d\n", HEADER_RESERVED_BITS);
  426.   printf("exec_magic_number: %s\n", EXEC_MAGIC);

  428.   /* Parse ld.conf and print the effective search path */
  429.   puts("shared_libs_path:");
  430.   caml_parse_ld_conf();
  431.   for (i = 0; i < caml_shared_libs_path.size; i++) {
  432.     dir = caml_shared_libs_path.contents[i];
  433.     if (dir[0] == 0)
  434. #ifdef _WIN32
  435.       /* See caml_search_in_path in win32.c */
  436.       continue;
  437. #else
  438.       dir = ".";
  439. #endif
  440.     printf("  %s\n", caml_stat_strdup_of_os(dir));
  441.   }
  442. }

  444. #ifdef _WIN32
  445. extern void caml_signal_thread(void * lpParam);
  446. #endif

  448. #ifdef _MSC_VER

  450. /* PR 4887: avoid crash box of windows runtime on some system calls */
  451. extern void caml_install_invalid_parameter_handler(void);

  453. #endif

  455. /* Main entry point when loading code from a file */

  457. ‌CAMLexport void caml_main(char_os **argv)
  458. {
  459.   int fd, pos;
  460.   struct exec_trailer trail;
  461.   struct channel * chan;
  462.   value res;
  463.   char * req_prims;
  464.   char_os * shared_lib_path, * shared_libs;
  465.   char_os * exe_name, * proc_self_exe;

  467.   /* Determine options */
  468.   caml_parse_ocamlrunparam();

  470. #ifdef DEBUG
  471.   caml_gc_message (-1, "### OCaml runtime: debug mode ###\n");
  472. #endif
  473.   if (!caml_startup_aux(/* pooling */ caml_params->cleanup_on_exit))
  474.     return;

  476.   caml_init_codefrag();

  478.   caml_init_locale();
  479. #ifdef _MSC_VER
  480.   caml_install_invalid_parameter_handler();
  481. #endif
  482.   caml_init_custom_operations();
  483.   caml_init_os_params();
  484.   caml_ext_table_init(&caml_shared_libs_path, 8);

  486.   /* Determine position of bytecode file */
  487.   pos = 0;

  489.   /* First, try argv[0] (when ocamlrun is called by a bytecode program) */
  490.   exe_name = argv[0];
  491.   fd = caml_attempt_open(&exe_name, &trail, 0);

  493.   /* Little grasshopper wonders why we do that at all, since
  494.      "The current executable is ocamlrun itself, it's never a bytecode
  495.      program".  Little grasshopper "ocamlc -custom" in mind should keep.
  496.      With -custom, we have an executable that is ocamlrun itself
  497.      concatenated with the bytecode.  So, if the attempt with argv[0]
  498.      failed, it is worth trying again with executable_name. */
  499.   if (fd < 0 && (proc_self_exe = caml_executable_name()) != NULL) {
  500.     exe_name = proc_self_exe;
  501.     fd = caml_attempt_open(&exe_name, &trail, 0);
  502.   }

  504.   if (fd < 0) {
  505.     pos = parse_command_line(argv);
  506.     if (caml_params->print_config) {
  507.       do_print_config();
  508.       exit(0);
  509.     }
  510.     if (argv[pos] == 0) {
  511.       error("no bytecode file specified");
  512.     }
  513.     exe_name = argv[pos];
  514.     fd = caml_attempt_open(&exe_name, &trail, 1);
  515.     switch(fd) {
  516.     case FILE_NOT_FOUND:
  517.       error("cannot find file '%s'",
  518.                        caml_stat_strdup_of_os(argv[pos]));
  519.       break;
  520.     case BAD_BYTECODE:
  521.       error(
  522.         "the file '%s' is not a bytecode executable file",
  523.         caml_stat_strdup_of_os(exe_name));
  524.       break;
  525.     case WRONG_MAGIC:
  526.       error(
  527.         "the file '%s' has not the right magic number: "\
  528.         "expected %s, got %s",
  529.         caml_stat_strdup_of_os(exe_name),
  530.         EXEC_MAGIC,
  531.         magicstr);
  532.       break;
  533.     }
  534.   }
  535.   /* Read the table of contents (section descriptors) */
  536.   caml_read_section_descriptors(fd, &trail);
  537.   /* Initialize the abstract machine */
  538.   caml_init_gc ();

  540.   /* bring up runtime_events after we've initialised the gc */
  541.   CAML_RUNTIME_EVENTS_INIT();

  543.   Caml_state->external_raise = NULL;
  544.   /* Setup signal handling */
  545.   caml_init_signals();
  546.   /* Initialize the interpreter */
  547.   caml_interprete(NULL, 0);
  548.   /* Initialize the debugger, if needed */
  549.   caml_debugger_init();
  550.   /* Load the code */
  551.   caml_code_size = caml_seek_section(fd, &trail, "CODE");
  552.   caml_load_code(fd, caml_code_size);
  553.   caml_init_debug_info();
  554.   /* Build the table of primitives */
  555.   shared_lib_path = read_section_to_os(fd, &trail, "DLPT");
  556.   shared_libs = read_section_to_os(fd, &trail, "DLLS");
  557.   req_prims = read_section(fd, &trail, "PRIM");
  558.   if (req_prims == NULL) caml_fatal_error("no PRIM section");
  559.   caml_build_primitive_table(shared_lib_path, shared_libs, req_prims);
  560.   caml_stat_free(shared_lib_path);
  561.   caml_stat_free(shared_libs);
  562.   caml_stat_free(req_prims);
  563.   /* Load the globals */
  564.   caml_seek_section(fd, &trail, "DATA");
  565.   chan = caml_open_descriptor_in(fd);
  566.   value global_data = caml_input_val(chan);
  567.   caml_modify_generational_global_root(&caml_global_data, global_data);
  568.   caml_close_channel(chan); /* this also closes fd */
  569.   caml_stat_free(trail.section);
  570.   /* Initialize system libraries */
  571.   caml_sys_init(exe_name, argv + pos);
  572.   /* Load debugging info, if b>=2 */
  573.   caml_load_main_debug_info();
  574.   /* ensure all globals are in major heap */
  575.   caml_minor_collection();
  576. #ifdef _WIN32
  577.   /* Start a thread to handle signals */
  578.   if (caml_secure_getenv(T("CAMLSIGPIPE")))
  579.     _beginthread(caml_signal_thread, 4096, NULL);
  580. #endif
  581.   /* Execute the program */
  582.   caml_debugger(PROGRAM_START, Val_unit);
  583.   res = caml_interprete(caml_start_code, caml_code_size);
  584.   if (Is_exception_result(res)) {
  585.     value exn = Extract_exception(res);
  586.     if (caml_debugger_in_use) {
  587.       Caml_state->current_stack->sp = &exn; /* The debugger needs the
  588.                                                exception value.*/
  589.       caml_debugger(UNCAUGHT_EXC, Val_unit);
  590.     }
  591.     caml_fatal_uncaught_exception(exn);
  592.   }
  593.   caml_terminate_signals();
  594. }

  596. /* Main entry point when code is linked in as initialized data */

  598. ‌CAMLexport value caml_startup_code_exn(
  599.            code_t code, asize_t code_size,
  600.            char *data, asize_t data_size,
  601.            char *section_table, asize_t section_table_size,
  602.            int pooling,
  603.            char_os **argv)
  604. {
  605.   char_os * exe_name;
  606.   value res;

  608.   /* Determine options */
  609.   caml_parse_ocamlrunparam();

  611. #ifdef DEBUG
  612.   caml_gc_message (-1, "### OCaml runtime: debug mode ###\n");
  613. #endif
  614.   if (caml_params->cleanup_on_exit)
  615.     pooling = 1;
  616.   if (!caml_startup_aux(pooling))
  617.     return Val_unit;

  619.   caml_init_codefrag();

  621.   caml_init_locale();
  622. #ifdef _MSC_VER
  623.   caml_install_invalid_parameter_handler();
  624. #endif
  625.   caml_init_custom_operations();
  626.   caml_init_os_params();

  628.   /* Initialize the abstract machine */
  629.   caml_init_gc ();

  631.   /* runtime_events has to be brought up after the gc */
  632.   CAML_RUNTIME_EVENTS_INIT();

  634.   exe_name = caml_executable_name();
  635.   if (exe_name == NULL) exe_name = caml_search_exe_in_path(argv[0]);

  637.   Caml_state->external_raise = NULL;
  638.   /* Setup signal handling */
  639.   caml_init_signals();
  640.   /* Initialize the interpreter */
  641.   caml_interprete(NULL, 0);
  642.   /* Initialize the debugger, if needed */
  643.   caml_debugger_init();
  644.   /* Load the code */
  645.   caml_start_code = code;
  646.   caml_code_size = code_size;
  647.   caml_init_code_fragments();
  648.   caml_init_debug_info();
  649. #ifdef THREADED_CODE
  650.   caml_thread_code(caml_start_code, code_size);
  651. #endif
  652.   /* Use the builtin table of primitives */
  653.   caml_build_primitive_table_builtin();
  654.   /* Load the globals */
  655.   caml_modify_generational_global_root
  656.     (&caml_global_data, caml_input_value_from_block(data, data_size));
  657.   /* Initialize system libraries */
  658.   caml_sys_init(exe_name, argv);
  659.   /* Load debugging info, if b>=2 */
  660.   caml_load_main_debug_info();
  661.   /* ensure all globals are in major heap */
  662.   caml_minor_collection();
  663.   /* Record the sections (for caml_get_section_table in meta.c) */
  664.   caml_init_section_table(section_table, section_table_size);
  665.   /* Execute the program */
  666.   caml_debugger(PROGRAM_START, Val_unit);
  667.   res = caml_interprete(caml_start_code, caml_code_size);
  668.   caml_terminate_signals();
  669.   return res;
  670. }

  672. ‌CAMLexport void caml_startup_code(
  673.            code_t code, asize_t code_size,
  674.            char *data, asize_t data_size,
  675.            char *section_table, asize_t section_table_size,
  676.            int pooling,
  677.            char_os **argv)
  678. {
  679.   value res;

  681.   res = caml_startup_code_exn(code, code_size, data, data_size,
  682.                               section_table, section_table_size,
  683.                               pooling, argv);
  684.   if (Is_exception_result(res)) {
  685.     value exn = Extract_exception(res);
  686.     if (caml_debugger_in_use) {
  687.       Caml_state->current_stack->sp = &exn; /* The debugger needs the
  688.                                                exception value.*/
  689.       caml_debugger(UNCAUGHT_EXC, Val_unit);
  690.     }
  691.     caml_fatal_uncaught_exception(exn);
  692.   }
  693. }

One Level Up Top Level
